Package cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models

Interface IGameBoard

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsGameBoard, GameBoard, GameBoardMem
    public interface IGameBoard
    An interface representing a 2D game board where (0,0) is the bottom left of the board. A game board is a grid-like data structure used in various board games. It provides methods for querying the current state of the board, as well as making and undoing moves on the board. Initialization ensures: The game board is in a valid starting state according to the rules of the game and has dimensions of getNumRows() by getNumColumns(). The board contains only blank characters at the beginning of the game.

    • Method Detail

      • checkIfFree

        default boolean checkIfFree​(int c)
        Returns true if the column can accept another token; false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        c - The column to check.
        Returns:
        True if the column is free, false otherwise.

      • whatsAtPos

        char whatsAtPos​(BoardPosition pos)
        Returns the character that is in the GameBoard at the specified position. If no marker is present at the position, a blank space character is returned.
        Parameters:
        pos - the BoardPosition to check for a marker
        Returns:
        the character at the specified position, or a blank space character if no marker is present
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified position is outside the bounds of the GameBoard

      • placeToken

        void placeToken​(char p,
                int c)
        Places the character p in column c. The token will be placed in the lowest available row in column c.
        Parameters:
        p - The player's token (e.g. 'X' or 'O').
        c - The column to place the token in.

      • checkForWin

        default boolean checkForWin​(int c)
        This function will check to see if the last token placed in column c resulted in the player winning the game. If so, it will return true, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        c - The column where the last token was placed.
        Returns:
        True if the placed token is the last to make up the maximum number of consecutive same markers needed to win either vertically, horizontally, or diagonally, false otherwise.

      • checkTie

        default boolean checkTie()
        This function will check to see if the game has resulted in a tie. A game is tied if there are no free board positions remaining. You do not need to check for any potential wins because we can assume that the players were checking for win conditions as they played the game. It will return true if the game is tied and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        True if the game is a tie, false otherwise.

      • checkHorizWin

        default boolean checkHorizWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                              char p)
        checks to see if the last token placed (which was placed in position pos by player p) resulted in 5 in a row horizontally. Returns true if it does, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        pos - The BoardPosition of the last token placed.
        p - The player's token
        Returns:
        True if the player has won, false otherwise.

      • checkVertWin

        default boolean checkVertWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                             char p)
        Checks to see if the last token placed (which was placed in position pos by player p) resulted in 5 in a row vertically. Returns true if it does, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        pos - The BoardPosition of the last token placed.
        p - The player's token
        Returns:
        True if the player has won, false otherwise.

      • checkDiagWin

        default boolean checkDiagWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                             char p)
        checks to see if the last token placed (which was placed in position pos by player p) resulted in 5 in a row diagonally. Returns true if it does, otherwise false
        Parameters:
        pos - The BoardPosition of the last token placed.
        p - The player's token
        Returns:
        True if the player has won, false otherwise.

      • isPlayerAtPos

        default boolean isPlayerAtPos​(BoardPosition pos,
                              char player)
        Returns true if the player is at pos; otherwise, it returns false
        Parameters:
        pos - The board position to check
        player - The player character to search for
        Returns:
        `true` if the player is at the given position; `false` otherwise.

      • getNumRows

        int getNumRows()
        returns the number of rows in the GameBoard
        Returns:
        The number of rows

      • getNumColumns

        int getNumColumns()
        returns the number of columns in the GameBoard
        Returns:
        The number of columns

      • getNumToWin

        int getNumToWin()
        returns the number of tokens in a row needed to win the game
        Returns:
        The number of tokens
